meanings.definition: A unit of computing speed equal to one billion floating-point operations per second.
meanings.sent1: My computer can process data at a speed of one billion gigaflops per second.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measure the performance of supercomputers in gigaflops.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could run as fast as a gigaflops when I'm late for school!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a gigaflops, swiftly solving complex problems.
meanings.sent5: The gigaflops speed of the new processor amazed everyone in the lab.

meanings.definition: The ability of a computer to perform one billion floating-point operations per second.
meanings.sent1: The gigaflops of the mainframe computer impressed the IT team.
meanings.sent2: Programmers aim to enhance the gigaflops of their systems for faster calculations.
meanings.sent3: The robot boasted about its gigaflops, claiming to be the fastest in the factory.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, gigaflops are like the horsepower of a computer.
meanings.sent5: The competition focused on achieving higher gigaflops to win the computing challenge.
